alert.note: Alert for Bennett County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Pine Ridge Area; Tripp County (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 31 at 10:49AM MST until January 31 at 6:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH THE AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 321, 322, 325, 326, 333, 334, AND 335 ACROSS SOUTHERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Very warm, windy and dry conditions are developing across downslope areas of the southern Black Hills and southern portions of South Dakota, ahead of a strong cold front moving into the Northern Plains. Winds will initially be out of the southwest...then switch to the northwest later today behind the cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST /7 PM CST/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 326, 333, 334, AND 335... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 326 Pine Ridge Area, 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Bennett County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Pine Ridge Area; Tripp County
